citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Based on semi-annual checklists and the semi-annual evaluation letter to the Institutional Official the facility has been
conducting a semi-annual facility inspection of the animals and animal areas but has not been conducting a complete
program review. The facility is using review of the approved protocols as their program review according to the semi-
annual evaluation report. The checklists covering the program review topics found in the IACUC records are not marked
as reviewed/completed. The IACUC must complete a review of the facility's program for humane care and use of animals
using the Animal Welfare Act and Regulations to help ensure that the IACUC and the facility are following all research
regulations covered by the Animal Welfare Act and Regulations.
The facility shall review, at least once every six months, the research facility's program for humane care and use of
animals, using title 9, chapter I, subchapter A--Animal Welfare. Correct by May 1, 2024.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC did not notify the principal investigator (PI) in writing of its decision to approve or disapprove of the protocols
related to the regulated species being used for teaching vet tech students (protocols EH, ER, GH and RH). This written
notification is necessary for the PI to know when the protocols are approved and when the animals can be used. Correct
by the IACUC providing written notification to the PI of decisions made regarding the review of proposed activities by
November 30, 2023.

At the time of inspection, there was no written documentation that an annual review was completed of the contingency
plan. Annual reviews of the contingency plan help ensure that identified emergency situations and measures are
adequately addressed for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care of animals in the event of an
emergency. The plan must be reviewed and documented by the research facility on at least an annual basis to ensure it
adequately addresses the regulatory requirements of contingency planning.
Correct by reviewing the contingency plan and documenting the review by November 30, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian.
Additional Inspectors:
Brittany Kessler, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
